ygData.subject: Re: Archmages and clerics
ygData.msgSnippet: Mind control can be useful, under certain circumstances. If the enemy is concentrated in a particular area at the beginning of a stage, and too far away for

X-Yahoo-Profile: TevildoII

Mind control can be useful, under certain
circumstances. If the enemy is concentrated in a
particular area at the beginning of a stage, and too
far away for you to use chain lightning on, mind
control is a good way to confuse them. They'll stop to
fight with themselves instead of charging right for
you, allowing you to get to a defensible position.
Some of the enemies might even be killed. After the
first use, though, mind control is much less
effective. I couldn't say why... it just controls
fewer enemies each time. If there were limits on how
many enemies could be controlled, and the duration
were more stable, this could be a useful spell.

Chain lightning can be just brutal, if used correctly.
Get the enemy to pile up against a wall or forest or
water, then let the crowd have it. Pow. I've killed
more than half the enemies in a level with just one
chain lightning on several occasions.

Summon elemental needs to be downgraded--it's just too
powerful!

I'd like to be able to see Magic Mace more easily,
rather than just fuzziness floating around the screen.
The rest of the cleric abilities are fine as they are.
   -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
